importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of publication indicates the current state of the 2025 MLB postseason, highlighting the ongoing competition between the Blue Jays and Dodgers for the World Series title.
Game 1 of the World Series is scheduled for October 24, 2025, marking the start of the championship series between the Blue Jays and Dodgers and signaling the culmination of the postseason.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The postseason spanned from late September to early October 2025, culminating in the World Series, reflecting the competitive timeline of Major League Baseball's championship season.

keyTakeAways: The Toronto Blue Jays have advanced to the World Series for the first time since 1993, after overcoming the Seattle Mariners in a hard-fought seven-game ALCS.
The Los Angeles Dodgers, with a massive payroll and a dominant postseason run, are the defending champions and face the Blue Jays in the World Series.
The Dodgers have won two World Series titles and five NL pennants in the past nine years, showing sustained success and competitiveness.
Shohei Ohtani delivered a legendary performance in Game 4 of the NLCS with three home runs and a 6.1 shutout innings, showcasing his all-around dominance.

The Blue Jays' strong offensive performance, including 34 runs in the ALDS against the Yankees, and their ability to survive a 2-0 series deficit against the Mariners, highlight their team resilience.
The Blue Jays' defensive and pitching strengths are key against the Dodgers, but the Dodgers' bullpen has been a weakness that could be exploited.
Game 1 of the World Series is scheduled for Friday, October 24, 2025, in Toronto, marking the beginning of the championship battle.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Toronto, Canada.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays are the team advancing to the World Series after a dramatic ALCS victory over the Mariners, making them a key player in the championship narrative.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Los Angeles, California.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are the defending World Series champions and the primary opponent in the upcoming World Series, making them central to the narrative of the postseason.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Seattle, Washington.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners were the Blue Jays' opponent in the ALCS and were the first team to reach the World Series in the modern era, but were eliminated in Game 7.

namedEntities.name: Shohei Ohtani
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A two-way superstar player for the Los Angeles Dodgers, known for his hitting and pitching abilities.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ohtani delivered a historic performance in Game 4 of the NLCS, contributing three home runs and a shutout, which helped secure the Dodgers' playoff victory.

namedEntities.name: Jeff Hoffman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A pitcher for the Toronto Blue Jays, who played a key role in the ALCS victory.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hoffman was instrumental in the Blue Jays' ALCS success and provided commentary on the team's resilience and close game management.

namedEntities.name: American League Championship Series (ALCS)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The playoff series determining the American League representative to the World Series.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays won the ALCS against the Mariners, securing their spot in the World Series and marking a significant milestone for the franchise.

namedEntities.name: National League Championship Series (NLCS)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The playoff series determining the National League representative to the World Series.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers won the NLCS against the Milwaukee Brewers, demonstrating their dominance in the postseason and setting up a World Series matchup.

namedEntities.name: World Series
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The championship series of Major League Baseball, pitting the AL and NL champions against each other.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The World Series is the culmination of the postseason, with the Blue Jays and Dodgers set to meet in the championship game starting October 24.

namedEntities.name: 2025 MLB season
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The current Major League Baseball season.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The 2025 MLB season includes the postseason run that culminates in the World Series, highlighting a competitive year for both franchises.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays, after a hard-fought seven-game victory over the Seattle Mariners in the ALCS, have advanced to the 2025 World Series for the first time since 1993. Their opponent is the Los Angeles Dodgers, who have won two World Series titles and five National League pennants in the past nine years, and are the defending champions. The Dodgers' postseason run was dominant, including a key performance by Shohei Ohtani, who recorded three home runs and a shutout in Game 4 of the NLCS. Despite a shaky regular season, the Dodgers excelled in the postseason, defeating the Philadelphia Phillies and Milwaukee Brewers. The Blue Jays, who turned around from a last-place finish in 2024, overcame the Yankees in the ALDS and narrowly avoided elimination in the ALCS. The series will begin on Friday, October 24, in Toronto, with the Blue Jays' offensive strength and defensive resilience posing a challenge to the Dodgers' otherwise dominant team, especially given the Dodgers' bullpen weakness.
title: Blue Jays Advance to World Series After ALCS Victory Over Mariners; Dodgers Eye Repeat Championship
